title: Sites List
description: This page. A list for PianoLab sites and applications.
implementation: SSG (Gatsby), Static JSON and GraphQL from gatsby-transformer-json
plan: Will be actively maintained in the future

title: PianoLab Main Website
description: The Lab's main website. Find everything you want to know about the lab here!
plan:
Migrate to Flatfile CMS (Grav) and SSG (Gatsby). Goal: A static site with flat-file CMS to manage content. We want to get rid of database and server side template based CMS for the following reasons:
1 We want a more secured site. A few database and PHP related attacks affected our site in the past, even if we update CMS often and used best practices to mitigate those attacks. In the future, the lab may or may not have someone with the expertise to prevent the attacks, or fix a compromised site. Static site certainly has the advantage in terms of site security and reliability.
2 We need more flexibility for developers. For simple things like styling or changing layout of certain pages, almost each template based CMS is different: some uses sub-theme or extra page templates, others use template engine and is tricky to attach custom CSS and JS. The time spent on learning these things are not neglectable, and the skills developed are hardly beneficial - both to the developer and to the lab - once switching out from that specific CMS.
3 We want faster load time. While there are many optimization techniques, for the labâ€™s website, this can be best achieved by using static website.

Challenge: non-technical people need an easy way to update content (wysiwyg editor), while developers should find it easy develop the site with the help of modern framework. At times, the lab would hire developers or non-developer for the technician position. Non-developers and lab admin staff will take the responsibility of updating the content, while developers can develop new features for the site.

Solution: SSG for view, Grav for content management.

title: Musician Wellness Centre
plan: Migrate to Flatfile CMS (Grav) and SSG (Gatsby); Also a possibility to relocate files to other server

title: OVL (Online Video Library)

title: Music Reading Test
description: A music reading test that shows user the notes to be played, and records their playing as CSV. A usb MIDI keyboard and Chrome browser is required. Can also run as a stand-alone desktop application.
plan: Finish the GraphQL implementation; write document

title: Surgical Training
description: For suturing and knot tying motor skill assesment across pianoists and non- pianoists.
type: Web Application that plays video and gathers non-sensitive data from anonymous users.
plan: Migrate from OVL; Is there a way to automate recording?

title: Batch Video Audio Converter and Splitter
